avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of the new snow the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent. Weak layers in the old snowpack necessitate caution.
avalancheActivity.comment: Some snow has fallen over a wide area. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in some places adjacent to ridgelines. The avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects. The old snowpack will be in most cases subject to considerable local variations. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted. This applies in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 1900 m. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack represent the main danger. There is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.comment: Distinct weak layers in the old snowpack necessitate defensive route selection. Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in isolated cases by individual winter sport participants in particular above approximately 1900 m. Avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. The avalanche prone locations are clearly recognisable to the trained eye.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack will be in most cases subject to considerable local variations. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. This applies in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 1900 m. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
